column3: THE FIGURES IN THIS TABLE ARE NOT NATIONAL STATISTICS

column2: The results in this table do not fall within the scope of National Statistics
due to the limitations of some of the primary sources, particularly
pre-1947, used to construct the index.
Further information and data back to 1750 are available in an article
entitled 'Consumer price inflation since 1750' to be found on the National
The percentage change in prices between any two months is
(later date index minus earlier date index) divided by earlier date index)
The purchasing power of a sum of money in one year  compared with
another is calculated using the following formulae:
The sum of money times (later date index divided by earlier date index)
